intro: Scleria setacea var. hemitaphra, commonly known as the narrowleaf spikerush, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Cyperaceae family, which includes sedges and related plants. The plant is characterized by its slender, grass-like stems and narrow, linear leaves. Its inflorescence consists of dense, spike-like clusters of small, three-lobed flowers. It typically grows in wet or marshy habitats and is often found in swampy areas or along water margins.
